text: Pyrausta signatalis, the raspberry pyrausta moth, is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by Francis Walker in 1866. It is found in North America, where it has been recorded from British Columbia to Ontario, south to North Carolina, South Carolina, Texas and Arizona.Moth Photographers Group. Mississippi State University. The habitat consists of aspen parkland and grasslands. The wingspan is 18–22 mm. The forewings are bright pink or purplish with white antemedial and postmedial lines, as well as a white discal spot. The hindwings are light brown.University of Alberta E.H. Strickland Entomological Museum The larvae feed on Monarda species, including Monarda fistulosa. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1866 signatalis Category:Moths of North America
title: Pyrausta signatalis
